wikipedia_page.main:
Ralph Arliss (born 11 September 1947) is a British actor.His television credits include: Doctor Who (in the serial Planet of the Spiders), Z-Cars, The Sweeney, Survivors, Return of the Saint, Secret Army, Love for Lydia, Shoestring, Airline, The Jewel in the Crown, The Day Christ Died, A.D., Dempsey and Makepeace, Call Me Mister, Boon, Prime Suspect, Casualty and The Bill. He played the leading role of Kickalong in the ITV serial Quatermass opposite Sir John Mills in 1979.His film appearances include roles in The Last Valley (1971), The Asphyx (1972), Deadly Strangers (1975), Blood Relations (1977) and Dead Man's Folly (1986).
He is involved in political training for the Green Party of England and Wales.

Love for Lydia was adapted into a 13-part serial by London Weekend Television, first broadcast in 1977. It featured several actors in performances which were early in their television careers, including Christopher Blake, Mel Martin, Christopher Hancock, Peter Davison, Jeremy Irons, Ralph Arliss and Sherrie Hewson. It also featured Rachel Kempson, Beatrix Lehmann and Michael Aldridge, as Lydia's eccentric relations, plus David Ryall and Sam Kydd.
* Ralph Arliss as Geoffrey, Count of Nantes
Cast: Janet McTeer, Clive Wood, Jonny Lee Miller, Elspet Gray, Simon Rouse, Ralph Arliss, Laurence Harrington
